We enjoyed our meal so much the first time, we went back another evening.    On our second visit, our service was so poor as to be bizarre.  The waiter broke a wine glass on the floor right next to our table, splashing wine on my pants and foot, and didn't even bother to clean up the broken glass!  He finally disappeared altogether, and a second waiter was conscripted to complete our dinner service.  As to the food, they serve tapas with fresh ingredients, including vegetables, and it was all delicious.  The presentation was attractive.   Guests are either seated at the bar or on the patio, which is intimate and yet spacious.  We ate on the patio on both visits.   Clientele seemed to be a mix of locals, corporate visitors, and some tourists.  If not for the service on our second visit I would have rated this restaurant with four stars.  I think they need an on site manager.
